question: 作業
sourceMnemonic:
If you want to <kanji>make</kanji> a <kanji>business</kanji> successful you need to be prepared to do a lot of <vocabulary>work</vocabulary>. Be ready to handle many <vocabulary>task</vocabulary>s and <vocabulary>operation</vocabulary>s!

<ja>作業</ja> often focuses on individual, hands-on tasks that are undertaken to accomplish a specific objective.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>作</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

You love the <vocabulary>work</vocabulary> involved in <reading>saw</reading>ing <reading>gyo</reading>za (<ja>さぎょう</ja>). There's something about taking a piece of gyoza and sawing right through it that you just love so much.
